definition: hidebound by convention (idiom)
ink stick/China ink/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/corporal punishment consisting of tattooing characters on the victim's forehead
surname Mo/abbr. for 墨西哥[Mo4 xi1 ge1], Mexico
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining
surname Cheng
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
compass/a rule/regulation/to admonish/to plan/to scheme

sentences.english: Why do we have to stick to conventions and dare not go one step beyond the prescribed limit?
sentences.chinese: 我們爲什麼要墨守成規，不敢越雷池一步呢？

sentences.english: He showed little initiative, handling all matters strictly by the book.
sentences.chinese: 他缺乏首創精神，墨守成規地辦一切事情。

sentences.english: You will never change their ideas. They are far too hidebound .
sentences.chinese: 你無法改變他們的意思，因爲他們太墨守成規。

sentences.english: Ted is a real stick- in- the- mud.
sentences.chinese: 特德真是個墨守成規的人。

definition: to become a mere formality
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
to capitulate
simplification/to simplify
to assess one's income and spend accordingly (idiom); to live within one's means/You can only spend what you earn.
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
see 拔苗助長|拔苗助长[ba2 miao2 zhu4 zhang3]
selfless/impartial
to be strict with oneself
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
important matter that must be kept secret (idiom); don't breathe a word of it to anyone!
not the least bit concerned/completely indifferent
law and order/rules and discipline
attempting nothing and accomplishing nothing (idiom); without any initiative or drive/feckless
it will cause no end of trouble (idiom)
(abbr. for 嘗試錯誤|尝试错误) trial and error/failure
